name: RenderElement3D
description: The `RenderElement3D` is a generic interface that defines the base functionality for all 3D rendering elements in JsMacros. It provides a common framework for rendering 3D objects in the world such as boxes, lines, and trace lines. This interface is implemented by various 3D rendering components that can be added to a `Draw3D` context for visualization in the Minecraft world.
overview:
The `RenderElement3D` interface serves as the foundation for 3D rendering in JsMacros, providing:

- Standardized rendering method that integrates with Minecraft's rendering system
- Comparable interface for sorting and ordering 3D elements
- Generic type parameter `T` that allows implementing classes to specify their own type for method chaining
- Integration with the `Draw3D` rendering system for world-space visualization

methods.name: render
methods.description: Implements the actual rendering logic for the 3D element. This method is called by the rendering system each frame to draw the element in the Minecraft world.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: The Minecraft drawing context used for rendering operations.

parameters.name: tickDelta
parameters.description: The partial tick delta, used for smooth animations between frames.

methods.name: compareToSame
methods.description: Compares this 3D rendering element with another element of the same specific type `T` for sorting purposes, typically based on rendering depth or priority.

parameters.name: other
parameters.description: The other `RenderElement3D` instance of the same type to compare with.

methods.name: compareTo
methods.description: Compares this 3D rendering element with another `RenderElement3D` instance for sorting purposes, implementing the `Comparable` interface to define a consistent rendering order.

parameters.name: other
parameters.description: The other `RenderElement3D` instance to compare with.
